line_1: When at the altar a new Monarch kneels,
line_2: What conjur'd awe upon the people steals!

line_1: See at her feet each generous Briton kneels,
line_2: Each views your inj'ries and your anguish feels;

line_1: Love dies — Lo! in yon corner down he kneels;
line_2: He rises, and his fleshless form reveals.

line_1: While clinging at his feet she kneels,
line_2: A thousand pangs her father feels,

line_1: While at his feet she trembling kneels,
line_2: A thousand pangs the father feels,

line_1: When, at the Shrine he hallow'd, Harley kneels?
line_2: What Bosom, but Devotion's Ardor feels,

line_1: But, hark! as bow'd to earth the Bramin kneels,
line_2: From heav'nly climes propitious thunder peals!
